answers.answer: The good news is that is looks like everything is in the normal range.  The only thing I see that may be an issue is your glucose.  Were you fasting during when you had the blood drawn?  If so, although your reading of 96 is technically in the "normal" range, it is heading toward the high side and you could have some blood sugar issues even though it is in the acceptable lab range.  There is another test called a Hemoglobin AIC that measures the average amount of glucose attached to your cells over three months.  It is more sensitive in alerting your doctor to glucose issues.  I had a glucose fasting lab result of 91 and yet my AIC was in the prediabetic range.  It is good to know early so that you can implement lifestyle changes before it progresses.  You may want to ask your doctor about getting this test since many of your symptoms are similar to those caused by prediabetes.  Here is a link to more information about that test:http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/a1c-test/MY00142/DSECTION=why-its-doneI hope you find the answers to why you are feeling poorly!
thanks - both tests were fasting.  I do have a family hx of diabetes.  I put on some weight (30 lbs in 6 weeks) when I quit smoking and also was taken off of fluoxitine, felodipine and spriolactane.

question: I was tested (fasting blood) for thyroid, RI, fibromygalia, mono, diabetes, etc.  Possible Edema, cushings or thyroid - please help me to talk to my DR - I don't know what all of this means as it looks to be in the normal ranges.  I had two tests for Thyroid (about 6 weeks apart).   I don't know that if along with my symptoms, family history and these results if it is even worth talking to a doctor.  I was so fed up with my "Primary Care Manger" assigned by my insurance (he saw me for 5 minutes and said I was under stress and would be fine).  I paid to see another doctor and spent 40 minutes with her - She at least listened.Family HX of heart disease, throid, depression, diabetes and cancer.  Quit smoking in March and gained 30 lbs in 6 weeks went to the doctor to make sure that my smoking wasn't masking something.  I still can't lose weight, suffer from fatigue, depression, severe constipation, no sense of taste, smell, loss of memory, concentration, headaches, insominia -I title: Need help interpreting Lab Results - so I know what to talk to my Doc about
